articles.title: –Ø–∫ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–∏ ¬´–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é¬ª —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–æ—é: –ü–æ–≤–Ω–∏–π –ø–æ—Å—ñ–±–Ω–∏–∫ –∑ Je t'aime
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–∞ ‚Äî –æ—Ñ—ñ—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–æ –≤–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞–π—Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ—à–æ—é –º–æ–≤–æ—é —Å–≤—ñ—Ç—É! –Ø–∫—â–æ –≤–∏ –≤–∏–≤—á–∞—î—Ç–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫—É –∑–∞—Ä–∞–¥–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è, –≤—ñ—Ç–∞—î–º–æ –∑ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∏–º –≤–∏–±–æ—Ä–æ–º. –£ —Ü—å–æ–º—É –ø–æ—Å—ñ–±–Ω–∏–∫—É –º–∏ —Ä–æ–∑–≥–ª—è–Ω–µ–º–æ –≤—Å—ñ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–∏ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–∏ ¬´—è —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é¬ª —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–æ—é.

## –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–∏–π –≤–∏—Ä–∞–∑: Je t'aime

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Je t'aime"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º"
  context="–ù–∞–π–≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ—à–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∞ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–æ—é ‚Äî –ø—Ä—è–º–∞, —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∞ —Ç–∞ –ø–æ—Ç—É–∂–Ω–∞."
/>

**Je t'aime** ‚Äî —Ü–µ –∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–∏–π —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç –≤–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–Ω—è –≤ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–æ—é. –¶—è —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∞ –Ω–µ—Å–µ –≥–ª–∏–±–æ–∫–∏–π –µ–º–æ—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏–π –∑–º—ñ—Å—Ç —ñ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è –≤–∏–∫–ª—é—á–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è.

### –†—ñ–∑–Ω–∏—Ü—è –º—ñ–∂ Je t'aime —Ç–∞ Je t'aime bien

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é (—Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ)"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º"
  example="Je t'aime, mon amour. (–Ø –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é —Ç–µ–±–µ, –º–æ—î –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime bien"
  translation="–¢–∏ –º–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—à—Å—è / –Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –ª—é–±–ª—é (–¥—Ä—É–∂–Ω—å–æ)"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º –±'—î–Ω"
  example="Je t'aime bien, tu es un bon ami. (–¢–∏ –º–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—à—Å—è, —Ç–∏ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–π –¥—Ä—É–≥)"
/>

<CultureTip title="–û–±–µ—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–æ –∑ 'bien'!" flag="üá´üá∑">
–î–æ–¥–∞–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è "bien" –¥–æ "Je t'aime" –ó–ú–ï–ù–®–£–Ñ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å! "Je t'aime bien" –æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–∞—î –¥—Ä—É–∂–Ω—é —Å–∏–º–ø–∞—Ç—ñ—é, –ù–ï —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è. –¶–µ —Ç–∏–ø–æ–≤–∞ –ø–æ–º–∏–ª–∫–∞ ‚Äî –Ω—ñ–∫–æ–ª–∏ –Ω–µ –∫–∞–∂—ñ—Ç—å "Je t'aime bien" —Å–≤–æ—î–º—É –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä—É!
</CultureTip>

## –î—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ "Aimer" ‚Äî –ö–æ—Ö–∞—Ç–∏/–õ—é–±–∏—Ç–∏

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Aimer"
  meaning="–∫–æ—Ö–∞—Ç–∏/–ª—é–±–∏—Ç–∏"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Je", polish: "aime", english: "—è –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é" },
    { person: "Tu", polish: "aimes", english: "—Ç–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î—à" },
    { person: "Il/Elle", polish: "aime", english: "–≤—ñ–Ω/–≤–æ–Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î" },
    { person: "Nous", polish: "aimons", english: "–º–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î–º–æ" },
    { person: "Vous", polish: "aimez", english: "–≤–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î—Ç–µ" },
    { person: "Ils/Elles", polish: "aiment", english: "–≤–æ–Ω–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é—Ç—å" }
  ]}
/>

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –≤–∞—Ä—ñ–∞—Ü—ñ—ó

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime tellement"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–∞–∫ —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º —Ç–µ–ª—å–º–∞–Ω"
  example="Je t'aime tellement, ma ch√©rie."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime de tout mon c≈ìur"
  translation="–Ø –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é —Ç–µ–±–µ –≤—Å—ñ–º —Å–µ—Ä—Ü–µ–º"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º –¥–µ —Ç—É –º–æ–Ω –∫–µ—Ä"
  example="Je t'aime de tout mon c≈ìur et de toute mon √¢me."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime plus que tout"
  translation="–Ø –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é —Ç–µ–±–µ –±—ñ–ª—å—à–µ –∑–∞ –≤—Å–µ"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º –ø–ª—é –∫–µ —Ç—É"
  example="Je t'aime plus que tout au monde."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime √† la folie"
  translation="–Ø –±–æ–∂–µ–≤—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º –∞ –ª–∞ —Ñ–æ–ª—ñ"
  example="Tu me rends fou, je t'aime √† la folie!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je suis tomb√©(e) amoureux/amoureuse de toi"
  translation="–Ø –∑–∞–∫–æ—Ö–∞–≤—Å—è/–∑–∞–∫–æ—Ö–∞–ª–∞—Å—å —É —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Å—é—ñ —Ç–æ–º–±–µ –∞–º—É—Ä–µ/–∞–º—É—Ä–µ–∑ –¥–µ —Ç—É–∞"
  example="D√®s que je t'ai vu, je suis tomb√© amoureux de toi."
/>

## –ü–æ–µ—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –≤–∏—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è

–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–∞ –º–æ–≤–∞ —Å–ª–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —Å–≤–æ—î—é –ø–æ–µ—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—é:

<VocabCard
  word="Tu es l'amour de ma vie"
  translation="–¢–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è –º–æ–≥–æ –∂–∏—Ç—Ç—è"
  pronunciation="—Ç—é –µ –ª—è–º—É—Ä –¥–µ –º–∞ –≤—ñ"
  example="Tu es l'amour de ma vie, je le sais."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je ne peux pas vivre sans toi"
  translation="–Ø –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂—É –∂–∏—Ç–∏ –±–µ–∑ —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ –Ω–µ –ø–µ –ø–∞ –≤—ñ–≤—Ä —Å–∞–Ω —Ç—É–∞"
  example="Je ne peux pas vivre sans toi, tu es tout pour moi."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tu es tout pour moi"
  translation="–¢–∏ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ"
  pronunciation="—Ç—é –µ —Ç—É –ø—É—Ä –º—É–∞"
  example="Sans toi, je ne suis rien. Tu es tout pour moi."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tu as vol√© mon c≈ìur"
  translation="–¢–∏ –≤–∫—Ä–∞–≤/–≤–∫—Ä–∞–ª–∞ –º–æ—î —Å–µ—Ä—Ü–µ"
  pronunciation="—Ç—é –∞ –≤–æ–ª–µ –º–æ–Ω –∫–µ—Ä"
  example="D√®s notre premi√®re rencontre, tu as vol√© mon c≈ìur."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je pense toujours √† toi"
  translation="–Ø –∑–∞–≤–∂–¥–∏ –¥—É–º–∞—é –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ –ø–∞–Ω—Å —Ç—É–∂—É—Ä –∞ —Ç—É–∞"
  example="Jour et nuit, je pense toujours √† toi."
/>

<CultureTip title="–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–∞ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏–∫–∞" flag="üá´üá∑">
–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑–∏ —Ü—ñ–Ω—É—é—Ç—å –∫—Ä–∞—Å—É —Å–ª—ñ–≤ —ñ –≤–º—ñ–Ω–Ω—è –≤–∏—Å–ª–æ–≤–ª—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è –ø–æ–µ—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ. –ù–µ –±—ñ–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ ‚Äî —Ü–µ —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–æ—ó –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è. –ü–∞—Ä–∏–∂ –Ω–µ –¥–∞—Ä–º–∞ –Ω–∞–∑–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç—å –º—ñ—Å—Ç–æ–º –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è!
</CultureTip>

## –õ–∞—Å–∫–∞–≤—ñ –ø—Ä—ñ–∑–≤–∏—Å—å–∫–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–æ—é

| –§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ | –í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞ |
|------------|------------|--------|
| Mon amour | –ú–æ—î –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è | –º–æ–Ω –∞–º—É—Ä |
| Mon c≈ìur | –ú–æ—î —Å–µ—Ä—Ü–µ | –º–æ–Ω –∫–µ—Ä |
| Ma ch√©rie / Mon ch√©ri | –ú–æ—è –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∞ / –ú—ñ–π –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∏–π | –º–∞ —à–µ—Ä—ñ / –º–æ–Ω —à–µ—Ä—ñ |
| Mon tr√©sor | –ú—ñ–π —Å–∫–∞—Ä–± | –º–æ–Ω —Ç—Ä–µ–∑–æ—Ä |
| Ma puce | –ú–æ—è –±–ª–æ—à–∫–∞ (–ª–∞—Å–∫–∞–≤–æ!) | –º–∞ –ø—é—Å |
| Mon chou | –ú–æ—è –∫–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∫–∞ | –º–æ–Ω —à—É |
| Ma belle / Mon beau | –ö—Ä–∞—Å—É–Ω–µ / –ö—Ä–∞—Å–µ–Ω—é | –º–∞ –±–µ–ª—å / –º–æ–Ω –±–æ |
| Mon ange | –ú—ñ–π –∞–Ω–≥–µ–ª | –º–æ–Ω –∞–Ω–∂ |
| Mon lapin | –ú—ñ–π –∑–∞–π—á–∏–∫ | –º–æ–Ω –ª–∞–ø–µ–Ω |

## –©–æ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è

### –í—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="Bonjour, mon amour"
  translation="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–Ω–∫—É, –º–æ—î –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è"
  pronunciation="–±–æ–Ω–∂—É—Ä, –º–æ–Ω –∞–º—É—Ä"
  example="Bonjour, mon amour. Tu as bien dormi?"
/>

### –ü—Ä–æ—Ç—è–≥–æ–º –¥–Ω—è

<VocabCard
  word="Tu me manques"
  translation="–Ø –∑–∞ —Ç–æ–±–æ—é —Å–∫—É—á–∞—é"
  pronunciation="—Ç—é –º–µ –º–∞–Ω–∫"
  example="Je suis au travail mais tu me manques d√©j√†."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je pense √† toi"
  translation="–î—É–º–∞—é –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ –ø–∞–Ω—Å –∞ —Ç—É–∞"
  example="Je pense √† toi tout le temps."
/>

### –£–≤–µ—á–µ—Ä—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="Bonne nuit, je t'aime"
  translation="–ù–∞ –¥–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, —è —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  pronunciation="–±–æ–Ω –Ω—é—ñ, –∂–µ —Ç–µ–º"
  example="Bonne nuit, mon amour. Je t'aime. Fais de beaux r√™ves."
/>

## –Ø–∫ –≤—ñ–¥–ø–æ–≤—ñ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ "Je t'aime"

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime aussi"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ —Ç–µ–∂ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º –æ—Å—ñ"
  example="‚Äî Je t'aime. ‚Äî Je t'aime aussi, mon c≈ìur."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Moi aussi, je t'aime"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–∂ —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  pronunciation="–º—É–∞ –æ—Å—ñ, –∂–µ —Ç–µ–º"
  example="‚Äî Je t'aime tellement. ‚Äî Moi aussi, je t'aime."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime encore plus"
  translation="–Ø –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é —Ç–µ–±–µ —â–µ –±—ñ–ª—å—à–µ"
  pronunciation="–∂–µ —Ç–µ–º –∞–Ω–∫–æ—Ä –ø–ª—é"
  example="‚Äî Je t'aime. ‚Äî Je t'aime encore plus!"
/>


## –®–≤–∏–¥–∫–∞ –¥–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∫–æ–≤–∞ —Ç–∞–±–ª–∏—Ü—è

| –§—Ä–∞–∑–∞ | –ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è | –Ü–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Å–∏–≤–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å |
|-------|----------|---------------|
| Je t'aime | –Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é | –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∞ |
| Je t'aime tellement | –Ø —Ç–∞–∫ —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é | –ë—ñ–ª—å—à —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Å–∏–≤–Ω–∞ |
| Je t'aime de tout mon c≈ìur | –Ø –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é —Ç–µ–±–µ –≤—Å—ñ–º —Å–µ—Ä—Ü–µ–º | –î—É–∂–µ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∞ |
| Je t'aime √† la folie | –Ø –±–æ–∂–µ–≤—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é | –ü—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–∞ |
| Je suis fou/folle de toi | –Ø –±–æ–∂–µ–≤–æ–ª—ñ—é –≤—ñ–¥ —Ç–µ–±–µ | –ü—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–∞ |

## –ü–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∏ —â–æ–¥–æ –≤–∏–º–æ–≤–∏

–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫–∞ –≤–∏–º–æ–≤–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ –±—É—Ç–∏ —Å–∫–ª–∞–¥–Ω–æ—é, –∞–ª–µ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–æ—é:

1. **R** ‚Äî –≥–æ—Ä–ª–æ–≤–µ, –º'—è–∫–µ (–Ω–µ —è–∫ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–µ)
2. **–ù–æ—Å–æ–≤—ñ –∑–≤—É–∫–∏** ‚Äî "on", "an", "in" –≤–∏–º–æ–≤–ª—è—é—Ç—å—Å—è —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –Ω—ñ—Å
3. **Liaison** ‚Äî –∑–≤'—è–∑—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Å–ª—ñ–≤ (je t'aime = "–∂–µ—Ç–µ–º")
4. **–ù—ñ–º–µ E** ‚Äî –∫—ñ–Ω—Ü–µ–≤–µ "e" —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –≤–∏–º–æ–≤–ª—è—î—Ç—å—Å—è
5. **U** ‚Äî —è–∫ —â–æ—Å—å —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–Ω—î –º—ñ–∂ "—É" —Ç–∞ "—é"

<CultureTip title="–ù–µ –±—ñ–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—É!" flag="üá´üá∑">
–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑–∏ —Ü—ñ–Ω—É—é—Ç—å —Å–ø—Ä–æ–±–∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —ó—Ö–Ω—å–æ—é –º–æ–≤–æ—é. –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–π –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç —É —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫—ñ–π –º–æ–∂–µ –±—É—Ç–∏ —á–∞—Ä—ñ–≤–Ω–∏–º! –ì–æ–ª–æ–≤–Ω–µ ‚Äî –Ω–∞–º–∞–≥–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è. –í–∞—à –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä –æ—Ü—ñ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –∑—É—Å–∏–ª–ª—è.
</CultureTip>

<CTA
  text="–ì–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ñ –æ–ø–∞–Ω—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—É —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—å–∫—É?"
  buttonText="–ü–æ—á–∞—Ç–∏ –ó–∞—Ä–∞–∑"
/>

articles.title: Spanish Jealousy & Trust Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Jealousy and trust are sensitive topics in any relationship. When you're with a Spanish speaker, knowing how to discuss these feelings in their language helps you communicate more authentically. Here are essential Spanish phrases for navigating these important conversations.

## Expressing Jealousy

### Estoy celoso/a
**Pronunciation:** ehs-TOY seh-LOH-soh/sah

**Meaning:** "I'm jealous"

**When to use it:** To honestly admit your feelings. Use "celoso" if male, "celosa" if female.

### Me pongo celoso/a cuando...
**Pronunciation:** meh POHN-goh seh-LOH-soh/sah KWAHN-doh

**Meaning:** "I get jealous when..."

**When to use it:** To explain specific triggers for your jealousy.

**Example:** "Me pongo celosa cuando pasas mucho tiempo con ella." (I get jealous when you spend a lot of time with her.)

### No me gustan los celos que siento
**Pronunciation:** noh meh GOOS-tahn lohs SEH-lohs keh SYEHN-toh

**Meaning:** "I don't like the jealousy I feel"

**When to use it:** To acknowledge your jealousy while showing self-awareness.

## Seeking Reassurance

### ¬øMe quieres solo a m√≠?
**Pronunciation:** meh KYEH-rehs SOH-loh ah MEE

**Meaning:** "Do you love only me?"

**When to use it:** When seeking reassurance of your partner's commitment.

### Necesito que me asegures que todo est√° bien
**Pronunciation:** neh-seh-SEE-toh keh meh ah-seh-GOO-rehs keh TOH-doh ehs-TAH byehn

**Meaning:** "I need you to assure me that everything's okay"

**When to use it:** When you need verbal reassurance.

### ¬øPuedes ayudarme a sentirme m√°s seguro/a?
**Pronunciation:** PWEH-dehs ah-yoo-DAHR-meh ah sehn-TEER-meh mahs seh-GOO-roh/rah

**Meaning:** "Can you help me feel more secure?"

**When to use it:** To ask for support with your insecurities.

## Building Trust

### Conf√≠o en ti
**Pronunciation:** kohn-FEE-oh ehn tee

**Meaning:** "I trust you"

**When to use it:** To express trust directly‚Äîpowerful and important.

### Quiero confiar completamente en ti
**Pronunciation:** KYEH-roh kohn-fee-AHR kohm-pleh-tah-MEHN-teh ehn tee

**Meaning:** "I want to trust you completely"

**When to use it:** When working toward deeper trust.

### ¬øC√≥mo podemos construir m√°s confianza?
**Pronunciation:** KOH-moh poh-DEH-mohs kohns-troo-EER mahs kohn-fee-AHN-sah

**Meaning:** "How can we build more trust?"

**When to use it:** To work together on strengthening trust.

## Giving Reassurance

### Solo tengo ojos para ti
**Pronunciation:** SOH-loh TEHN-goh OH-hohs PAH-rah tee

**Meaning:** "I only have eyes for you"

**When to use it:** A romantic way to reassure your partner.

### Eres el √∫nico/la √∫nica para m√≠
**Pronunciation:** EH-rehs ehl OO-nee-koh/lah OO-nee-kah PAH-rah mee

**Meaning:** "You're the only one for me"

**When to use it:** To affirm your commitment.

### No tienes nada de qu√© preocuparte
**Pronunciation:** noh TYEH-nehs NAH-dah deh keh preh-oh-koo-PAHR-teh

**Meaning:** "You have nothing to worry about"

**When to use it:** To calm your partner's concerns.

### Mi coraz√≥n es tuyo
**Pronunciation:** mee koh-rah-SOHN ehs TOO-yoh

**Meaning:** "My heart is yours"

**When to use it:** A romantic declaration of devotion.

## Setting Healthy Boundaries

### Los celos est√°n afectando nuestra relaci√≥n
**Pronunciation:** lohs SEH-lohs ehs-TAHN ah-fehk-TAHN-doh NWEHS-trah reh-lah-SYOHN

**Meaning:** "Jealousy is affecting our relationship"

**When to use it:** To address when jealousy becomes problematic.

### Necesito mi espacio personal
**Pronunciation:** neh-seh-SEE-toh mee ehs-PAH-syoh pehr-soh-NAHL

**Meaning:** "I need my personal space"

**When to use it:** To establish healthy boundaries.

### Confiar es importante para m√≠
**Pronunciation:** kohn-fee-AHR ehs eem-pohr-TAHN-teh PAH-rah mee

**Meaning:** "Trust is important to me"

**When to use it:** To express your values around trust.

## Cultural Considerations

Spanish-speaking cultures can have varying attitudes toward jealousy. Some see mild jealousy as a sign of caring, while excessive jealousy ("ser muy celoso/a") is generally seen as unhealthy.

Open communication about feelings is often valued. Expressing emotions, including insecurity, is generally more accepted than suppressing them.

Building "confianza" (trust) takes time and consistent actions. Words matter, but behavior matters more.

## Growing Together

Discussing jealousy and trust in Spanish allows for deeper intimacy with your partner. These conversations, though difficult, strengthen your relationship. Remember that trust is built through many small moments of honesty and care‚Äî"poco a poco" (little by little).

articles.title: Grammaire norvegienne : les bases essentielles pour debutants
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Le norvegien est proche du suedois et du danois. Sa grammaire est relativement simple - bonne nouvelle pour les francophones !

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Jeg elsker deg"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="yay EL-sker day"
  context="Le verbe 'elske' (aimer) se conjugue tr√®s simplement !"
/>

## Les trois genres

Le norvegien bokm√•l a trois genres : masculin, feminin et neutre.

<VocabCard
  word="en / ei / et"
  translation="un (masc) / une (fem) / un (neutre)"
  pronunciation="√®ne / ay / √®te"
  example="Les trois articles indefinis"
/>

| Genre | Article indefini | Article defini | Exemple |
|-------|------------------|----------------|---------|
| Masculin (en) | en | -en | en mann ‚Üí mannen (l'homme) |
| Feminin (ei) | ei | -a | ei jente ‚Üí jenta (la fille) |
| Neutre (et) | et | -et | et barn ‚Üí barnet (l'enfant) |

<CultureTip title="Article defini suffixe" flag="üá≥üá¥">
Comme en suedois, l'article defini se place √† la FIN du mot en norvegien ! C'est un suffixe : ¬´ hus ¬ª (maison) ‚Üí ¬´ huset ¬ª (la maison). Tr√®s logique une fois qu'on s'y habitue.
</CultureTip>

## Les pronoms personnels

| Fran√ßais | Norvegien | Prononciation |
|----------|-----------|---------------|
| Je | jeg | yay |
| Tu | du | du |
| Il | han | hann |
| Elle | hun | hun |
| Nous | vi | vi |
| Vous (pluriel) | dere | D√à-re |
| Ils/Elles | de | di |

<VocabCard
  word="Du vs De/Dere"
  translation="Tu vs Vous"
  pronunciation="du / d√®-re"
  example="Le tutoiement est la norme en Norv√®ge !"
/>

<CultureTip title="Tutoiement universel" flag="üá≥üá¥">
Comme en Su√®de, on tutoie tout le monde en Norv√®ge ! Le vouvoiement a pratiquement disparu. Votre partenaire trouvera probablement etrange si vous vouvoiez sa famille.
</CultureTip>

## Conjugaison des verbes

Grande nouvelle : les verbes norvegiens ne changent PAS selon la personne !

### Le present

<VocabCard
  word="Elske (aimer)"
  translation="M√™me forme pour toutes les personnes"
  pronunciation="EL-ske"
  example="Jeg elsker, du elsker, han elsker..."
/>

| Personne | Elske (aimer) | V√¶re (√™tre) | Ha (avoir) |
|----------|---------------|-------------|------------|
| Jeg | elsker | er | har |
| Du | elsker | er | har |
| Han/Hun | elsker | er | har |
| Vi | elsker | er | har |
| Dere | elsker | er | har |
| De | elsker | er | har |

### Types de verbes

| Groupe | Infinitif | Present | Exemple |
|--------|-----------|---------|---------|
| 1 | -e | -er | snakke ‚Üí snakker (parler) |
| 2 | -e | -er | lese ‚Üí leser (lire) |
| 3 | court | -r | bo ‚Üí bor (habiter) |
| Irreg. | - | - | v√¶re ‚Üí er (√™tre) |

<CultureTip title="Simplification !" flag="üá≥üá¥">
Pas besoin de memoriser six formes differentes comme en fran√ßais ! Une seule forme suffit pour toutes les personnes. Le norvegien est tr√®s accueillant pour les apprenants.
</CultureTip>

## L'ordre des mots

### Phrase affirmative

<VocabCard
  word="Sujet - Verbe - Reste"
  translation="L'ordre de base"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="Jeg elsker deg"
/>

### Le verbe en deuxi√®me position (V2)

<VocabCard
  word="V2 - Verbe toujours en position 2"
  translation="Comme en allemand et suedois"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="I dag elsker jeg deg"
/>

## Le passe

### Le preterit (passe simple)

<VocabCard
  word="Preterit : -et/-te/-de"
  translation="Temps du passe principal"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="Jeg elsket"
/>

| Present | Preterit | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|----------|
| elsker | elsket | aime ‚Üí aima/aimait |
| snakker | snakket | parle ‚Üí parla/parlait |
| leser | leste | lit ‚Üí lut/lisait |

## La negation

<VocabCard
  word="Ikke"
  translation="Ne...pas"
  pronunciation="I-ke"
  example="Jeg forst√•r ikke"
/>

| Affirmatif | Negatif |
|------------|---------|
| Jeg forst√•r | Jeg forst√•r ikke |
| Jeg elsker deg | Jeg elsker deg ikke |

## Questions essentielles

<VocabCard
  word="Hva?"
  translation="Quoi ?"
  pronunciation="va"
  example="Hva gj√∏r du?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hvem?"
  translation="Qui ?"
  pronunciation="v√®m"
  example="Hvem er det?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hvor?"
  translation="O√π ?"
  pronunciation="vour"
  example="Hvor er du?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hvorfor?"
  translation="Pourquoi ?"
  pronunciation="vour-FOR"
  example="Hvorfor elsker du meg?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hvordan?"
  translation="Comment ?"
  pronunciation="VOUR-dan"
  example="Hvordan har du det?"
/>

## Phrases romantiques avec grammaire

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg elsker deg"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="yay EL-sker day"
  example="Deg"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er alt for meg"
  translation="Tu es tout pour moi"
  pronunciation="du √®r alt for may"
  example="For meg"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg vil v√¶re med deg"
  translation="Je veux √™tre avec toi"
  pronunciation="yay vil V√à-re m√® day"
  example="Med"
/>

## Les adjectifs

<VocabCard
  word="Adjectifs : accord avec le nom"
  translation="S'accordent en genre et nombre"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="en fin mann / et fint barn"
/>

| Genre | Singulier | Pluriel |
|-------|-----------|---------|
| en | fin (beau) | fine |
| ei | fin | fine |
| et | fint | fine |

## Conseils pour progresser

1. **Profitez de la conjugaison simple** - Une forme pour tous !
2. **Apprenez le genre avec les mots** - en, ei ou et ?
3. **Pratiquez l'article suffixe** - hus ‚Üí huset
4. **Maitrisez la r√®gle V2** - Verbe en 2e position
5. **Parlez avec votre partenaire** - Tutoiement naturel

<CTA />

articles.title: Swedish Proposal & Engagement Phrases: How to Pop the Question
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Proposing in your partner's native language is one of the most romantic gestures you can make. Whether you're planning an elaborate frieri or a simple, heartfelt moment, knowing how to express your intentions in Swedish will make this milestone unforgettable. This guide covers everything from the perfect proposal phrases to announcing your f√∂rlovning to family and friends.

For more romantic expressions, see our guide on [Swedish pet names and terms of endearment](/blog/en/swedish-pet-names-and-terms-of-endearment).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Vill du gifta dig med mig?"
  translation="Will you marry me?"
  pronunciation="Vill du gifta dig med mig?"
  context="The most important question you'll ever ask."
/>

## The Proposal Vocabulary

Master these essential words before your big moment:

<VocabCard
  word="ring"
  translation="ring"
  pronunciation="ring"
  example="The engagement ring sparkles beautifully."
/>

| Swedish | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| frieri | proposal | The act of proposing |
| f√∂rlovning | engagement | The period before marriage |
| ring | ring | The engagement ring |
| f√§stman | fianc√© | Engaged man |
| f√§stm√∂ | fianc√©e | Engaged woman |
| ja | yes | The answer you're hoping for |
| f√∂r alltid | forever | For eternity |
| mitt livs k√§rlek | love of my life | Romantic declaration |

<CultureTip flag="üá∏üá™" title="Proposal Traditions">
In Swedish-speaking cultures, proposal traditions may include asking the parents for their blessing beforehand. This traditional gesture is still valued by many families and can make a wonderful impression.
</CultureTip>

## Ways to Propose

### The Classic Proposal
**"Vill du gifta dig med mig?"** - Will you marry me?

This simple, direct question is perfect for any setting. Practice the pronunciation until it feels natural.

### More Romantic Variations
- **"You are the mitt livs k√§rlek. Vill du gifta dig med mig?"** - Adding a declaration of love
- **"I want to spend f√∂r alltid with you."** - Building to the question
- **"Will you make me the happiest person in the world?"** - An alternative approach

<VocabCard
  word="f√∂rlovad"
  translation="engaged"
  pronunciation="f√∂rlovad"
  example="We are f√∂rlovad!"
/>

## Announcing Your Engagement

Once your partner says "ja!", you'll want to share the news:

### To Family
- **"We're f√∂rlovad!"** - The joyful announcement
- **"f√§stman/f√§stm√∂ said ja!"** - Sharing the excitement
- **"We have wonderful news!"** - Building anticipation

### To Friends
- **"Guess what happened?"** - Creating suspense
- **"Look at my ring!"** - Showing off the ring
- **"We're getting married!"** - Direct and joyful

### On Social Media
- **"She/He said ja!"** - Classic announcement
- **"f√∂r alltid starts now!"** - Romantic caption
- **"f√∂rlovad to my mitt livs k√§rlek"** - Heartfelt declaration

<CultureTip flag="üá∏üá™" title="Engagement Celebrations">
In many Swedish-speaking families, an f√∂rlovning party is held to celebrate the couple. This gathering allows both families to meet and celebrate the upcoming union together.
</CultureTip>

## Ring Vocabulary

The ring is central to the frieri:

| Swedish | English | Description |
|---|---|---|
| ring | ring | The piece of jewelry |
| Engagement ring | engagement ring | The symbol of commitment |
| Diamond | diamond | Popular gemstone |
| Gold | gold | Common metal |
| Fit | fit | How the ring sits |

## Preparing Your Proposal

### Practice Tips
1. **Record yourself** saying the proposal
2. **Practice with your partner's name**
3. **Time your delivery** for natural flow
4. **Prepare for emotion** - it's okay to be nervous

### Setting the Scene
Consider these romantic elements:
- A meaningful location
- The right moment
- Having someone to photograph (secretly!)
- The ring ready and accessible

## After They Say Yes

The moments after the frieri are magical:

| Moment | What to Say | Translation |
|---|---|---|
| Right after | I love you so much! | Declaration of love |
| First call | We're f√∂rlovad! | Announcement |
| First photo | My f√§stman/f√§stm√∂! | New title |

For more ways to express your love, explore our [how to say I love you in Swedish](/blog/en/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-swedish) guide.

## Quick Reference

| Purpose | Phrase |
|---|---|
| Propose | Vill du gifta dig med mig? |
| React to yes | You said ja! |
| Announce | We're f√∂rlovad! |
| Introduce | My f√§stman/f√§stm√∂ |

Your frieri in Swedish will be a story you'll tell f√∂r alltid. Take your time, speak from the heart, and let your love shine through every word.

<CTA />
